metadata.title: CVE-2021-23961 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - medium.
metadata.description: Further techniques that built on the slipstream research combined with a malicious webpage could have exposed both an internal network's hosts as well as services running on the user's local machine. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 85.

advisory.discovered_by: Samy Kamkar, Ben Seri, and Gregory Vishnepolsky

notes.note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox package in hirsute was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '85.0+build1-0ubuntu1').
mozjs78 package in hirsute is affected and may need fixing.
thunderbird package in hirsute was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:78.11.0+build1-0ubuntu0.21.04.2').
